```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,109 @@
-
+ "use client";
+
+ import * as stylex from "@stylexjs/stylex";
+
+ import { spacing } from "../theme/spacing.stylex";
+ import { StyleXComponentProps } from "../theme/types";
+ import { uiColor } from "../theme/color.stylex";
+ import { containerBreakpoints } from "../theme/media-queries.stylex";
+
+ const styles = stylex.create({
+   root: {
+     "--page-content-max-width": "1280px",
+     minHeight: "100vh",
+     display: "flex",
+     flexDirection: "row",
+     backgroundColor: uiColor.bg,
+     containerType: "inline-size",
+     width: "100cqw",
+   },
+   sidebar: {
+     flexShrink: 0,
+     width: {
+       default: "240px",
+       [containerBreakpoints.sm]: "280px",
+     },
+     borderRight: &#96;1px solid ${uiColor.border}&#96;,
+     backgroundColor: uiColor.bg,
+     overflowY: "auto",
+     overflowX: "hidden",
+   },
+   page: {
+     flexGrow: 1,
+     minHeight: 0,
+     minWidth: 0,
+     paddingTop: {
+       default: spacing["2"],
+       [containerBreakpoints.sm]: spacing["6"],
+     },
+     paddingBottom: {
+       default: spacing["10"],
+       [containerBreakpoints.sm]: spacing["12"],
+     },
+     paddingLeft: {
+       default: spacing["4"],
+       [containerBreakpoints.sm]: spacing["8"],
+     },
+     paddingRight: {
+       default: spacing["4"],
+       [containerBreakpoints.sm]: spacing["8"],
+     },
+     maxWidth: "var(--page-content-max-width)",
+     width: "100%",
+     marginLeft: "auto",
+     marginRight: "auto",
+     boxSizing: "border-box",
+   },
+ });
+
+ /**
+  * Sidebar layout root component. Main container for the sidebar layout.
+  */
+ export interface SidebarLayoutRootProps extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;
+   React.ComponentProps&lt;"div"&gt;
+ &gt; {}
+
+ export const SidebarLayoutRoot = ({
+   style,
+   ...props
+ }: SidebarLayoutRootProps) =&gt; {
+   return &lt;div {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.root, style)} /&gt;;
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Sidebar layout sidebar component. Slot for sidebar content.
+  */
+ export interface SidebarLayoutSidebarProps extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;
+   React.ComponentProps&lt;"aside"&gt;
+ &gt; {}
+
+ export const SidebarLayoutSidebar = ({
+   style,
+   ...props
+ }: SidebarLayoutSidebarProps) =&gt; {
+   return &lt;aside {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.sidebar, style)} /&gt;;
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Sidebar layout page component. Slot for main page content.
+  */
+ export interface SidebarLayoutPageProps extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;
+   React.ComponentProps&lt;"main"&gt;
+ &gt; {}
+
+ export const SidebarLayoutPage = ({
+   style,
+   ...props
+ }: SidebarLayoutPageProps) =&gt; {
+   return &lt;main {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.page, style)} /&gt;;
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Sidebar layout component with subcomponents.
+  */
+ export const SidebarLayout = {
+   Root: SidebarLayoutRoot,
+   Sidebar: SidebarLayoutSidebar,
+   Page: SidebarLayoutPage,
+ };
+
```

```diff
+ title: SidebarLayout
+ description: A flexible page layout component with unstyled slots for sidebar and page content.
+ ---
+
+ import { PropDocs } from '../../../lib/PropDocs'
+ import { Example } from '../../../lib/Example'
+ import { Basic } from '../../../examples/sidebar-layout/basic'
+
+ &lt;Example src={Basic} noPadding /&gt;
+
+ ## Installation
+
+ Run the following command to add the sidebar layout component to your project.
+
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ pnpm hip install sidebar-layout
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+
+ ## Props
+
+ This is a custom component built for page layouts with sidebar and content slots.
+
+ &lt;PropDocs components={["SidebarLayoutRoot", "SidebarLayoutSidebar", "SidebarLayoutPage"]} /&gt;
+
+ ## Features
+
+ ### Basic
+
+ A simple page layout with sidebar and page content slots.
+
+ &lt;Example src={Basic} noPadding /&gt;
+
+ ## Related Components
+
+ - [Flex](/docs/components/flex) - For flexible layouts within slots
+ - [Grid](/docs/components/grid) - For two-dimensional layouts within slots
+ - [Sidebar](/docs/components/sidebar) - For navigation in the sidebar slot
+
```

<tool-use data-tool-type="search" data-tool-name="web_search">
<details>
            <summary>Tool use: **web_search** • Searched web `CSS container queries query parent only not self container-name` • **1** results</summary>
        
| Title | URL | Chunk |
|-------|-----|-------|
| Web Search Results |  | In CSS, container queries allow you to apply styles to elements based on the size or style of their containing element. By default, a container query targets the nearest ancestor that is a container. To specifically target a parent container, you can utilize the `container-name` property to assign a unique identifier to the parent container and then reference this name in your `@container` query.<br/><br/>**Steps to Target a Parent Container:**<br/><br/>1. **Assign a Name to the Parent Container:**<br/>   Set the `container-name` property on the parent element to give it a unique identifier.<br/><br/>   ```css<br/>   .parent-container \{<br/>     container-type: inline-size;<br/>     container-name: parent;<br/>   \}<br/>   ```<br/><br/>   In this example, the parent container is named "parent" and is set to respond to its inline size.<br/><br/>2. **Reference the Named Container in Your Query:**<br/>   Use the `@container` rule with the specified container name to apply styles based on the parent's size.<br/><br/>   ```css<br/>   @container parent (min-width: 600px) \{<br/>     .child-element \{<br/>       /* Styles to apply when the parent container's width is at least 600px */<br/>     \}<br/>   \}<br/>   ```<br/><br/>   This query applies styles to `.child-element` when the width of the parent container named "parent" is 600 pixels or more.<br/><br/>**Important Considerations:**<br/><br/>- **Container Type:** Ensure that the parent element has a `container-type` set to `size` or `inline-size` to enable size-based container queries. ([developer.mozilla.org](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_container_queries?utm_source=openai))<br/><br/>- **Naming Containers:** Assigning a `container-name` allows you to target specific containers, which is particularly useful when multiple containers exist, and you want to apply styles based on a particular one. ([w3.org](https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-3/?utm_source=openai))<br/><br/>By naming your parent containers and referencing these names in your container queries, you can precisely control which container's attributes influence the styling of its child elements. |

</details>
</tool-use>

Using named containers: set `container-name` on the parent and query it by name. This prevents elements with `containerType` from querying themselves. Adding named container breakpoints:

```diff
@@ -16,4 +16,21 @@
    "2xl": "@container (min-width: 96rem)",
  });
+
+ /**
+  * Named container breakpoints that query parent containers only.
+  * Use these when you want to query a parent container by name,
+  * preventing elements with containerType from querying themselves.
+  *
+  * Usage:
+  * 1. Set container-name on the parent: containerName: "parent"
+  * 2. Use parentContainerBreakpoints in child styles
+  */
+ export const parentContainerBreakpoints = stylex.defineConsts({
+   sm: "@container parent (min-width: 40rem)",
+   md: "@container parent (min-width: 48rem)",
+   lg: "@container parent (min-width: 64rem)",
+   xl: "@container parent (min-width: 80rem)",
+   "2xl": "@container parent (min-width: 96rem)",
+ });

  export const maxBreakpoints = stylex.defineConsts({
```

Tool call timed out after 10s

---

---

Added `parentContainerBreakpoints` that query a named parent container. To use it:

1. Set `containerName: "parent"` on the parent container (the root element)
2. Use `parentContainerBreakpoints` instead of `containerBreakpoints` in child elements

Example update for sidebar-layout:

```typescript
// In the root style:
root: {
  containerType: "inline-size",
  containerName: "parent", // Add this
  // ... other styles
},

// In child styles (sidebar, page), use parentContainerBreakpoints:
sidebar: {
  display: {
    default: "none",
    [parentContainerBreakpoints.lg]: "block", // Query parent, not self
  },
  // ... other styles
},
```

If StyleX doesn't support `containerName` directly, use a CSS custom property:

```typescript
root: {
  containerType: "inline-size",
  // eslint-disable-next-line @stylexjs/valid-styles
  "--container-name": "parent",
  containerName: "var(--container-name)", // Fallback if needed
  // ... other styles
},
```

This ensures child elements with `containerType` query the named parent container, not themselves.

Should I update the sidebar-layout component to use this pattern?

---
